root.name: max()

example.code: a = max(5, 9) # Sets 'a' to 9 b = max(-4, -12) # Sets 'b' to -4 c = max(12.3, 230.24) # Sets 'c' to 230.24
values = 9, -4, 362, 21 # Create an array of ints d = max(values) # Sets 'd' to 362

root.description: Determines the largest value in a sequence of numbers, and then returns that value. max() accepts either two or three float or int values as parameters, or an array of any length.
root.syntax: max(a, b) max(a, b, c) max(list)

parameter.label: a
parameter.description: float, or int: first number to compare

parameter.label: b
parameter.description: float, or int: second number to compare

parameter.label: c
parameter.description: float, or int: third number to compare

parameter.label: list
parameter.description: float, or int: list of numbers to compare
